Tanasīva：A landowner of Mātuvelanga and a supporter of Kupikkala-Mahātissa Thera．When Vattagāmanī，the king，was in hiding，the thera entrusted him to the care of Tanasīva，who，for fourteen years，looked after him，his queen，Anulādevī，and his two sons．Then，as the result of a dispute between Anulā and Tanasīva’s wife，Vattagāmanī shot him dead．Mhv．xxxiii．52-65．
